item.title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance II release date moved up to February 4, 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/kingdom-come-deliverance-ii-release-date-moved-up-to-february-4-2025

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Story trailer drops on December 5.

Publisher Deep Silver and developer Warhorse Studios have moved up Kingdom Come: Deliverance II from its previously planned February 11, 2025 release date to February 4, 2025. It will be available for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store. The game has also gone gold, meaning development is more or less finished and in the last stretch of bug fixing.

A “bunch of more exciting news” is planned for release in the next few days, including a new story trailer set to premiere on December 5 alongside the announcement of both console and PC specifications. This includes information about PlayStation 5 Pro enhancements, and “Quality” and “Performance” modes on consoles.

Here is an overview of the game, via Deep Silver:

About

Kingdom Come: Deliverance II is a thrilling action RPG, set amid the chaos of a civil war in 15th Century Bohemia.

You are Henry of Skalitz—an ordinary man doing extraordinary things—caught in a gripping tale of revenge, betrayal and discovery as he embarks on an epic journey, “from a humble blacksmith’s forge to the court of Kings,” as he searches for purpose in this beautiful but brutal medieval world.

From bustling city streets to lush forests, discover this open-world Medieval Europe through an unforgettable adventure filled with action, thrill and wonder.

Key Features

  • A Tale of Love and Revenge – Live life through the eyes and actions of Henry, a young man on a quest to avenge his murdered parents. His story—illustrated with over five hours of stunning cinematics—takes him from aspiring warrior to rebel, crossing paths with a charismatic cast of characters and an unforgettable set of adventures, as he goes up against the King of Hungary, Sigismund the Red Fox and his fearsome allies.
  • A True RPG Experience – Your actions shape Henry’s destiny and how the world will react to him. Customize freely his appearance, skills and equipment while taking a moral stance on the events around you. Travel round the land engaging in unique activities, such as blacksmithing and archery, to truly immerse yourself in this vibrant region of Europe that will remember your actions, forever.
  • Live a Life Medieval – This stunningly authentic rendition of 15th Century Bohemia allows you to experience this fascinating setting like never before. Get lost in a sprawling city, engage with peasants and talk with nobles while exploring a vast and rich countryside with taverns, bath houses, castles and more.
  • Authentic First-Person Combat – Feel the clash of steel and visceral combat as you engage in thrilling real-time battles. There’s a range of authentic weapons and combat styles to suit every player. On foot, horse or by stealth, you can specialize in elegant sword mastery, brutal blunt weapons or deadly ranged attacks.

item.title: Morkull Ragast’s Rage launches digitally on January 16, 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/morkull-ragasts-rage-launches-digitally-on-january-16-2025

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

A rare reverse release.

Side-scrolling action platformer Morkull Ragast’s Rage will launch digitally for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch, and PC via Steam on January 16, 2025, publisher Selecta Play and developer Disaster Games announced.

A physical edition of the game is available today for PlayStation 5 and Switch in Europe. A North American physical release is also planned, but is currently without a confirmed release date.

Here is an overview of the game, via Selecta Play:

About

A 2D video game that combines platforming and action with a touch of exploration, control Morkull, God of Death and Darkness and Lord of the Ragast. His main mechanic—breaking the fourth wall, which allows him to communicate with you in a multitude of ways.

Morkull Ragast’s Rage is a 2D video game that combines platforming and action with a touch of exploration.

You control Morkull, the villain of the story, who not only knows he’s a character in a video game, but is also aware of the player who controls him (i.e., you) and the developers who created him (i.e., us).

Your objective? Help Morkull escape from the Ragast so he can rule the world and carry out his evil plans.

You know, typical cliche villain stuff…

Key Features

  • Art and Animation – Morkull Ragast’s Rage is completely hand-drawn and animated frame-by-frame. Inspired and influenced by traditional animated films and other 2D video games, the old-school style gives life and fluidity of movement to the whole cast of characters.
  • Break the Fourth Wall – What makes this game special is Morkull himself, his personality, and his ability to break the fourth wall to talk with the players like he was there in the room. Morkull possesses charisma and charm, and never fails to create a light-hearted atmosphere with his endless humor, bad jokes and pop culture references.
  • Combat System – You’ll have all the power of the God of Death and Darkness at your fingertips, of course, along with an ample selection of combos and abilities that will open up even the most remote corners of the Ragast.
  • Become Part of the Ragast and Join Our Community – Once you enter the Ragast, you’ll never leave—unless you can get through Morkull… So why not join his ranks and support his Machiavellian cause with the rest of his champions as part of our Morkull Ragast’s Rage community.

item.title: Faaast Penguin for Xbox Series launches December 11
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/faaast-penguin-for-xbox-series-launches-december-11

  • Xbox Series

Currently available for PlayStation 5, Switch, and PC.

The Xbox Series version of free-to-play multiplayer racing game Faaast Penguin will launch on December 11, developer historia announced.

Faaast Penguin first launched for PlayStation 5 and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store on September 20, followed by Switch on on October 3. The game is currently in its second season.

Get the latest details below.

About the Game

Faaast Penguin is an exhilarating and chaotic survival action race where countless rival penguins clash! Set in various global resort locations, players race through high-speed water slides, desert pyramids, jungle waterfalls, and even above the clouds! Use attacks, Ultimate Rides, and shortcuts to reach the finish line faster than anyone else!

Limited-Time Event: “High-Speed Merry Christmaaas!” Kicks Off!

From December 4 to 25, the limited-time event “High-Speed Merry Christmaaas!” will be live after maintenance concludes!

Christmas-themed items like “Santa” and “Red-Nosed Reindeer” make their debut.

Complete limited-time challenges and shop for festive costumes to celebrate the holiday season!

Limited-Time Item Code Distribution!

The consumable item “Christmas Lights” from the limited-time event “High-Speed Merry Christmaaas!” will be available via item codes once maintenance is complete! We’re also distributing the “Round and round floats” as a reward for reaching 500,000 pre-registrations! Be sure to enter the codes during the event periods and try them out in the game!

  • Christmas Lights
    • Item Code: EVX4 FFFF PPPP LCMD
    • Redemption Deadline: December 25, 2024 at 10:00 p.m. PST
  • Round and round floats
    • Item Code: CAXX FFFF PPPP RNBN
    • Redemption Deadline: December 31, 2024 at 9:00 p.m. PST

How to Redeem:

  1. Open the menu and select “Settings & Support.”
  2. Under the “Game” section, select “Redeem” within “Item Code” under “Support.”
  3. Enter the item code.

item.title: DoDonPachi True Death coming to Switch on December 19 in Japan
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/dodonpachi-true-death-coming-to-switch-on-december-19-in-japan

  • Switch

CAVE Interactive-developed bullet hell shoot 'em up published by Live Wire.

Live Wire will release a Switch version of CAVE Interactive-developed bullet hell shoot ’em up DoDonPachi True Death via Nintendo eShop on December 19 in Japan for 4,400 yen, the company announced. It will only support Japanese as a language option.

DoDonPachi True Death, or DoDonPachi SaiDaiOuJou, first launched for arcades on April 20, 2012 in Japan, followed by Xbox 360 on May 30, 2013. The arcade version was localized and released by exA-Arcadia in November 2020 worldwide.
